job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Data Scientist Job DescriptionSummaryâ¢ Responsible for overseeing the collection, storage and interpretation of data forbusinesses.â¢ Sift through data points to create organized categories, comparing data points to currentcompany processes and writing reports outlining business predictions or proposals.Duties and Responsibilitiesâ¢ Use data to help businesses make decisions by collecting data through means such asanalyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studiesâ¢ Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysisâ¢ Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect dataâ¢ Building tools to automate data collectionâ¢ Searching through large data sets for usable informationâ¢ Creating reports and presentations for business usesâ¢ Correlating similar data to find actionable results data Scientist skills and qualificationsRequired Skillsâ¢ Exceptional technical writing skillsâ¢ Ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable wayâ¢ Ability to visualize data in the most effective way possible for a given project or studyâ¢ Analytical and problem-solving skillsâ¢ Experience with machine learning and AIâ¢ Familiarity with data management toolsâ¢ Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgroundsâ¢ Excellent attention to detailâ¢ Data Scientist education and training requirementsEducationâ¢ Major: Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineeringâ¢ Bachelorâs degree with 7+ yearsâ¢ Masterâs degree with 5+ years (preferred)The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.Â Â ResponsibilitiesAnalyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processingDesign accurate and scalable prediction algorithmsCollaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to productionGenerate actionable insights for business improvementsQualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)At least 10 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelingDeep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithmsFluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)
